p: Artificial sweeteners are synthetic sugar substitutes, but they can be derived from natural sources like herbs or sugar itself. Artificial sweeteners are characterized by high-intensity sweetness, many times sweeter than sucrose. This implies that to achieve the same level of sweetness conferred by sucrose only a minimal amount of artificial sweetener is needed. Furthermore, artificial sweeteners have a low or even no nutritional value, and do not affect blood glucose levels [ 111].
